Post.title: Ruby open3
Post._content:
## open3

open3stderropen3

```
stdin, stdout, stderr, wait_thr = Open3.popen3([env,] cmd... [, opts])
```

stdoutstderropen3

## 

stderrstdout` `IO.select` `

```
inp,out,err = open3("process","args")
inp.close # we pass everything via command-line, so close child's stdin at once
still_open = [out,err]  # Array that only contains the opened streams
while not still_open.empty?
  fhs = select(still_open,nil,nil,nil) # wait for data available in the pipes
  # fhs[0] is an array that contains filehandlers we can read from
  if fhs[0].include? out
    begin
      printf("%s",out.readline())
    rescue EOFError  # If we have read everything from the pipe
      # Remove out from the list of open pipes
      still_open.delete_if {|s| s==out}
    end
  end
  if fhs[0].include? err
    begin
      printf("ERROR: %s",err.readline())
    rescue EOFError  # If we have read everything from the pipe
      # Remove err from the list of open pipes
      still_open.delete_if {|s| s==err}
    end
  end
end
```

### 

```
sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d
```

### 

```
cd /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d
touch http-proxy.conf
```

### http-proxy.confhttp

```
[Service] Environment="HTTP_PROXY=http://proxy.example.com:80/" "NO_PROXY=localhost,127.0.0.1"
```

### 

```
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
```

### docker

```
sudo systemctl restart docker
```

```
$ systemctl show --property=Environment docker
```

Post.title: debiankubeadm v1.16.3Kubernetes
Post._content:
# 

debian 9 masternode

## docker

[docker](https://www.cnblogs.com/luoSteel/p/10038954.html)  
[docker ](https://download.docker.com/linux/static/stable/x86_64/)  

### 

```bash
tar -xvf docker-18.06.1-ce.tgz
```

### docker /usr/bin/ 

```bash
cp docker/* /usr/bin/
```

### dockerservice

```bash
vim /etc/systemd/system/docker.service
```

docker.service

```bash
[Unit]

Description=Docker Application Container Engine

Documentation=https://docs.docker.com

After=network-online.target firewalld.service

Wants=network-online.target

[Service]

Type=notify

# the default is not to use systemd for cgroups because the delegate issues still

# exists and systemd currently does not support the cgroup feature set required

# for containers run by docker

ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd

ExecReload=/bin/kill -s HUP $MAINPID

# Having non-zero Limit*s causes performance problems due to accounting overhead

# in the kernel. We recommend using cgroups to do container-local accounting.

LimitNOFILE=infinity

LimitNPROC=infinity

LimitCORE=infinity

# Uncomment TasksMax if your systemd version supports it.

# Only systemd 226 and above support this version.

#TasksMax=infinity

TimeoutStartSec=0

# set delegate yes so that systemd does not reset the cgroups of docker containers

Delegate=yes

# kill only the docker process, not all processes in the cgroup

KillMode=process

# restart the docker process if it exits prematurely

Restart=on-failure

StartLimitBurst=3

StartLimitInterval=60s

 

[Install]

WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

### 

```bash
chmod +x /etc/systemd/system/docker.service             #docker
systemctl daemon-reload                                 #unit
systemctl start docker                                  #Docker
systemctl enable docker.service                         #
```

### 

```bash
systemctl status docker                                 #Docker
docker -v                                               #Docker
```

## swapselinux

```bash
swapoff -a

systemctl stop firewalld
```

## k8s



```bash
sudo curl -s https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt/doc/apt-key.gpg | sudo apt-key add
sudo cat <<EOF >/etc/apt/sources.list.d/kubernetes.list
deb http://apt.kubernetes.io/ kubernetes-xenial main
EOF
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install kubelet=1.16.3-00 kubeadm=1.16.3-00 kubectl=1.16.3-00 kubernetes-cni
```

# kubeadmk8s

## 



```bash
$ kubeadm init \
    --image-repository registry.aliyuncs.com/google_containers \
    --kubernetes-version v1.16.3 \
    --pod-network-cidr=10.244.0.0/16
...
Your Kubernetes control-plane has initialized successfully!

To start using your cluster, you need to run the following as a regular user:

  mkdir -p $HOME/.kube
  sudo cp -i /etc/kubernetes/admin.conf $HOME/.kube/config
  sudo chown $(id -u):$(id -g) $HOME/.kube/config

You should now deploy a pod network to the cluster.
Run "kubectl apply -f [podnetwork].yaml" with one of the options listed at:
  https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/addons/

You can now join any number of control-plane nodes by copying certificate authorities 
and service account keys on each node and then running the following as root:

  kubeadm join 192.168.9.10:6443 --token px979r.mphk9ee5ya8fgy44 \
    --discovery-token-ca-cert-hash sha256:5e7c7cd1cc1f86c0761e54b9380de22968b6b221cb98939c14ab2942223f6f51 \
    --control-plane 	  

Then you can join any number of worker nodes by running the following on each as root:

kubeadm join 192.168.9.10:6443 --token px979r.mphk9ee5ya8fgy44 \
    --discovery-token-ca-cert-hash sha256:5e7c7cd1cc1f86c0761e54b9380de22968b6b221cb98939c14ab2942223f6f51 

```

 `kubeconfig` 

## k8s

 `kubectl get pods -A`  `coredns`  `running` 

```bash
$ kubectl apply -f "https://cloud.weave.works/k8s/net?k8s-version=$(kubectl version | base64 | tr -d '\n')"
```

## helm

### 
mastermaster

```bash
$ kubectl get nodes
NAME       STATUS   ROLES    AGE    VERSION
linx-dev   Ready    master   138m   v1.16.3

$ kubectl describe node linx-dev  | grep Taint
Taints:             node-role.kubernetes.io/master:NoSchedule

// Taintsnone
kubectl taint nodes linx-dev node-role.kubernetes.io/master:NoSchedule-
```

### 

```bash
wget https://get.helm.sh/helm-v2.16.3-linux-amd64.tar.gz
```

### helm

```bash
tar xf helm-v2.16.3-linux-amd64.tar.gz
cp linux-amd64/helm /usr/local/bin
```

### 

```bash
helm init --client-only --stable-repo-url https://aliacs-app-catalog.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/charts/
helm repo add incubator https://aliacs-app-catalog.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/charts-incubator/
helm repo update
```

###  Kubernetes 

```bash
// serviceaccount
kubectl create serviceaccount --namespace kube-system tiller

// 
kubectl create clusterrolebinding tiller-cluster-rule --clusterrole=cluster-admin --serviceaccount=kube-system:tiller
```

###  -i

```bash
helm init --service-account tiller --upgrade -i registry.cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/google_containers/tiller:v2.16.3  --stable-repo-url https://kubernetes.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/charts
```

## openebs

### openebs

```bash
kubectl apply -f https://openebs.github.io/charts/openebs-operator-1.5.0.yaml
```

### 

```bash
$ kubectl patch storageclass openebs-hostpath -p '{"metadata": {"annotations":{"storageclass.kubernetes.io/is-default-class":"true"}}}'
storageclass.storage.k8s.io/openebs-hostpath patched
```

## kubesphere

```bash
kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubesphere/ks-installer/master/kubesphere-minimal.yaml
```

## 

[Helm](https://www.jianshu.com/p/2bb1dfdadee8)

Post.title: ruby
Post._content:
## &: 

&: &:  `item.fun()` 

```ruby
irb(main):001:0> a = [1, 2, 3]
=> [1, 2, 3]
irb(main):002:0> a.map(&:to_s)
=> ["1", "2", "3"]

```



```ruby
irb(main):004:0> a.map { |i| i.to_s  }
=> ["1", "2", "3"]
```

## ruby%

### %Q %q

%Q. ,  (")   
%q

```ruby
2.3.0 :015 > %Q(rudy said, "i'm not ruby")
 => "rudy said, \"i'm not ruby\""
```

```ruby
2.3.0 :031 > what_ruby = 'this is ruby'
 => "this is ruby"
2.3.0 :032 > %Q!rudy said, "#{what_ruby}"!
 => "rudy said, \"this is ruby\""
2.3.0 :033 > %q!rudy said, "#{what_ruby}"!
 => "rudy said, \"\#{what_ruby}\""
```

(...), #...#, !...!, +...+, {...}, [...], <...>, /.../.

```ruby
2.3.0 :016 > %Q/rudy said, "i'm not ruby"/
 => "rudy said, \"i'm not ruby\""
2.3.0 :017 > %Q#rudy said, "i'm not ruby"#
 => "rudy said, \"i'm not ruby\""
2.3.0 :018 > %Q!rudy said, "i'm not ruby"!
 => "rudy said, \"i'm not ruby\""
```

### %W%w

%W%Q, .
%w%q, .

```ruby
2.3.0 :031 > what_ruby = 'this is ruby'
 => "this is ruby"
2.3.0 :034 > %W(hello,kitty,cat,dog,what_ruby)
 => ["hello,kitty,cat,dog,what_ruby"]          ###
2.3.0 :035 > %W(hello kitty cat dog what_ruby)
 => ["hello", "kitty", "cat", "dog", "what_ruby"]
2.3.0 :036 > %W(hello kitty cat dog #{what_ruby})
 => ["hello", "kitty", "cat", "dog", "this is ruby"]###
2.3.0 :037 > %w(hello kitty cat dog #{what_ruby})
 => ["hello", "kitty", "cat", "dog", "\#{what_ruby}"]###
```

### %x

shell

```ruby
2.3.0 :038 > %x(route -n)
 => "Kernel IP routing table\nDestination     Gateway         Genmask         Flags Metric Ref    Use Iface\n0.0.0.0         10.6.0.1        0.0.0.0         UG    100    0        0 eth0\n10.6.0.0        0.0.0.0         255.255.252.0   U     0      0        0 eth0\n"
2.3.0 :039 > %x(echo "hello world")
 => "hello world\n"
```

### %r

%Q, .

```ruby
2.3.0 :031 > what_ruby = 'this is ruby'
 => "this is ruby"
2.3.0 :041 > %r(/home/#{what_ruby})
 => /\/home\/this is ruby/
```

### %s

symbol, 

```ruby
2.3.0 :031 > what_ruby = 'this is ruby'
 => "this is ruby"
2.3.0 :042 > %s(a b c)
 => :"a b c"
2.3.0 :043 > %s(abc)
 => :abc
2.3.0 :044 > %s(what_ruby)
 => :what_ruby
2.3.0 :045 > %s(#{what_ruby})
 => :"\#{what_ruby}"
```

### %i

Ruby 2.0 , symbol

```ruby
2.3.0 :031 > what_ruby = 'this is ruby'
 => "this is ruby"
2.3.0 :046 > %i(a b c)
 => [:a, :b, :c]
2.3.0 :047 > %i(a b c #{what_ruby})
 => [:a, :b, :c, :"\#{what_ruby}"]
```

## *

*, 

```ruby
irb(main):001:0> a = [1,2,3]
=> [1, 2, 3]
irb(main):002:0> b,*c = a
=> [1, 2, 3]
irb(main):003:0> c
=> [2, 3]
irb(main):004:0> b
=> 1
```



```ruby
irb(main):001:0> def test(a, b)
irb(main):002:1> puts a
irb(main):003:1> puts b
irb(main):004:1> end
=> :test
irb(main):005:0> c = [1,2]
=> [1, 2]
irb(main):006:0> test(*c)
1
2
=> nil
```

## 

ruby `+`  `-`  `-` 2

```ruby
irb(main):001:0> a = [1,2,3]
=> [1, 2, 3]
irb(main):002:0> b = [2,3,4]
=> [2, 3, 4]
irb(main):003:0> a - b
=> [1]
irb(main):004:0> a + b
=> [1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4]
```

## jsonsymbol

```ruby
irb(main):005:0> require 'json'
=> true
irb(main):006:0> a = {b:1, c:2}
=> {:b=>1, :c=>2}
irb(main):007:0> JSON.generate(a)                       # symbolkey
=> "{\"b\":1,\"c\":2}"
irb(main):008:0> JSON.parse(JSON.generate(a))
=> {"b"=>1, "c"=>2}
irb(main):009:0> JSON.parse(JSON.generate(a), symbolize_names: true)
=> {:b=>1, :c=>2}
```

## send

send

```ruby
irb(main):001:0> def test(a)
irb(main):002:1> puts a

```

(...), #...#, !...!, +...+, {...}, [...], <...>, /.../.

## 

1CentOS 7.3
2Docker18.06.1 [](https://download.docker.com/linux/static/stable/x86_64/)
3https://docs.docker.com/install/linux/docker-ce/binaries/#install-static-binaries

## Docker

1

```bash
tar -xvf docker-18.06.1-ce.tgz
```

2docker /usr/bin/ 

```bash
cp docker/* /usr/bin/
```

3dockerservice

```bash
vim /etc/systemd/system/docker.service
```

docker.service

```bash
[Unit]

Description=Docker Application Container Engine

Documentation=https://docs.docker.com

After=network-online.target firewalld.service

Wants=network-online.target

[Service]

Type=notify

# the default is not to use systemd for cgroups because the delegate issues still

# exists and systemd currently does not support the cgroup feature set required

# for containers run by docker

ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd

ExecReload=/bin/kill -s HUP $MAINPID

# Having non-zero Limit*s causes performance problems due to accounting overhead

# in the kernel. We recommend using cgroups to do container-local accounting.

LimitNOFILE=infinity

LimitNPROC=infinity

LimitCORE=infinity

# Uncomment TasksMax if your systemd version supports it.

# Only systemd 226 and above support this version.

#TasksMax=infinity

TimeoutStartSec=0

# set delegate yes so that systemd does not reset the cgroups of docker containers

Delegate=yes

# kill only the docker process, not all processes in the cgroup

KillMode=process

# restart the docker process if it exits prematurely

Restart=on-failure

StartLimitBurst=3

StartLimitInterval=60s

 

[Install]

WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

4

```bash
chmod +x /etc/systemd/system/docker.service             #docker
systemctl daemon-reload                                 #unit
systemctl start docker                                  #Docker
systemctl enable docker.service                         #
```

5

```bash
systemctl status docker                                 #Docker
docker -v                                               #Docker
```

hls.jshls

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en" dir="ltr">

<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>hls.js</title>
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="./index.css">
  <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/hls.js@latest"></script>
</head>

<body>
  <video id="video" controls></video>
  <script src="./index.js" charset="utf-8"></script>
</body>

</html>
```

 `index.js`

```js
var Hls = window.Hls
var url = 'http://localhost:8765/hls/movie.m3u8'
var video = document.getElementById('video')
if (Hls.isSupported()) {
  var hls = new Hls()
  hls.loadSource(url)
  hls.attachMedia(video)
  hls.on(Hls.Events.MANIFEST_PARSED, function() {
    // video.play()
  })
} else if (video.canPlayType('application/vnd.apple.mpegurl')) {
  video.src = url
  video.addEventListener('canplay', function() {
    // video.play()
  })
}
```

```

### 

# Debug179

```bash
vim auto/cc/gcc
#CFLAGS="$CFLAGS -g"
```

### 

```bash
$ cd nginx

$ ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/nginx --user=www --group=www --with-http_stub_status_module --with-http_ssl_module
```

### 

```bash
$ make
$ make install
```

### 

```bash
ln -s /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx /usr/local/sbin/
```

## nginx

### 

```bash
server {
    listen 3333;
    server_name xx.xxx.xxx.xxx;
    location / {
        proxy_pass xxx.xxx.xx.xxx;
    }
    location ^~ /asd {              # 
        proxy_pass xxx.xxx.xx.xxx;
    }
}
```

### 

> conf :   
> html:   
> logs  
> sbinshell  

### conf/nginx.config

```bash
main                                # 

events {                            # nginx
    ....
}

http {                                # http
    ....

    server {                        # 
        ....
        location {                    # 
            ....
        }
            upstream name {                    # 
        ....
    }
}
```

6

> mainnginx  
> eventsnginx  
> httphttp  
> server  
> location  
> upstream

sreverhttp

```bash
server {
    listen        80;
    server_name localhost    192.168.1.100;

    index        index.php index.html index.html;
    charset        utf-8;
    access_log    logs/access.log;
    error_log    logs/error.log;
    ......
}
```

}

## Object.prototype.toString.call

### 1. 

```js
Object.prototype.toString.call(null); //"[object Null]"
Object.prototype.toString.call(undefined); //"[object Undefined]"
Object.prototype.toString.call("abc"); //"[object String]"
Object.prototype.toString.call(123); //"[object Number]"
Object.prototype.toString.call(true); //"[object Boolean]"
```

### 2. 

```js

Function fn() {
  console.log("test");
}
Object.prototype.toString.call(fn); //"[object Function]"

var date = new Date();
Object.prototype.toString.call(date); //"[object Date]"

var arr = [1, 2, 3];
Object.prototype.toString.call(arr); //"[object Array]"

var reg = /[hbc]at/gi;
Object.prototype.toString.call(arr); //"[object RegExp]"


function Person(name, age) {
  this.name = name;
  this.age = age;
}
var person = new Person("Rose", 18);
Object.prototype.toString.call(person); //"[object Object]"
```

## instance of

`instanceof`  

```js
var a = new Array();
alert(a instanceof Array);
```

  `true`  `alert(a instanceof Object)`  `true` ;  `Array`  `object`   
  `instanceof`  `false`

```js
var a = '123'
undefined
a instanceof Object
false

var a = new String('123')
undefined
a instanceof Object
true
```

var str = "";

  for (var i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
    result += '*';
  }
  return result; //*
});

Post._content:
# 

## 

|    |    IP    |      | docker |  |       |                    |
| :----: | :----------: | :--------: | :--------: | :------: | :-------: | :--------------------: |
| master | 192.168.9.10 | k8s-master |  18.09.9   |   2c4g   | CentOS7.7 | 3.10.0-1062.el7.x86_64 |
| node1  | 192.168.9.13 | k8s-node1  |  18.09.9   |   2c6g   | CentOS7.7 | 3.10.0-1062.el7.x86_64 |
| node2  | 192.168.9.14 | k8s-node2  |  18.09.9   |   2c6g   | CentOS7.7 | 3.10.0-1062.el7.x86_64 |

## host

```bash
cat >> /etc/hosts <<EOF
192.168.9.10 k8s-master
192.168.9.13 k8s-node1
192.168.9.14 k8s-node2
EOF
```

## selinux

```bash
//
systemctl stop firewalld && systemctl disable firewalld

//selinux
#
setenforce 0

#
sed -i '7s/enforcing/disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
```

## ` ` ` /etc/sysctl.d/k8s.conf ` ` `

```bash
//
cat >/etc/sysctl.d/k8s.conf <<EOF
net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables = 1
net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables = 1
net.ipv4.ip_forward = 1
